speaker: A
speech: Mr Chairman Sir

speaker: A
speech: In Singapore we do not really know the extent of the population that have disabilities

speaker: A
speech: Using an estimate of three point eight percent used by Asian countries such as Hong Kong and Japan there are about ninety seven thousand disabled people in Singapore

speaker: A
speech: The services for disabled people provided by the voluntary welfare organizations cater only for about eight thousand disabled people

speaker: A
speech: The question is are we doing enough

speaker: A
speech: There are four areas which I would like to touch on

speaker: A
speech: Firstly a national registry of disabled persons

speaker: A
speech: Despite the shortcomings of the previous central registry of disabled persons I believe that the ministry should set up a national registry of disabled persons

speaker: A
speech: For this registry to succeed the referral process must be made simple and the referral sources identified

speaker: A
speech: Sources of referrals should include hospitals school health services maternal and child health clinics polyclinics and schools

speaker: A
speech: Without a proper database it will be difficult to project manpower needs and plan for infra-structural needs

speaker: A
speech: By making the referral process easy and by increasing public awareness of the registry the government will be able to get a better approximation of the incidence of disabled persons and the different disabilities involved

speaker: A
speech: This will be extremely useful for future planning

speaker: A
speech: Secondly educational and training programs

speaker: A
speech: Currently there are insufficient special schools

speaker: A
speech: The vocational training in sheltered workshop programs are limited and there's a shortage of trained staff

speaker: A
speech: What plans do the ministry have in overcoming these shortcomings

speaker: A
speech: Thirdly national coordinating centre for the disabled

speaker: A
speech: The ministry should work with the Singapore Council of Social Services in setting up a coordinating centre for the disabled which will employ full-time staff

speaker: A
speech: The centre will maintain the registry coordinate the activities of all government and voluntary associations providing for the disabled and plan for future infra-structural needs

speaker: A
speech: Lastly activities of daily living

speaker: A
speech: To facilitate the disabled in their integration

speaker: A
speech: I'm heartened that in many places the buildings have been designed to cater for the needs of those who are disabled

speaker: A
speech: We can do more for example MCD should coordinate with the HDB to help disabled persons who apply for HDB flats to obtain flats that are at that

speaker: A
speech: To obtain flats that are at the ground floor or at the same level as the lift

speaker: A
speech: We must do more for fellow Singaporeans who are disabled

speaker: A
speech: What plans do the ministry have in facilitating the disabled in their activities of daily living
